treatment.description: Stems 3.5–8 cm. Leaves: petioles stout; blades usually 1-nerved, linear, 40(–70) × 1–1.5 mm, bases about as wides as blades, margins ciliate, faces usually at least ± scabrous. Heads 1(–2).
treatment.discussion: Stenotus armerioides var. gramineus is known only from Green River Formation shales of the Uintah Basin of Duschesne and Uintah counties.
